text:
Trying to get the rows with the top N items from some column. Can anyone think of a better way than this?

```julia> df = DataFrame(x = 1:10, y = rand(10));

julia> function findmaxn(v, n)
           srt = invperm(sortperm(v,rev=true))
           findall(<=(n), srt)
       end
findmaxn (generic function with 1 method)

julia> df[findmaxn(df.y, 3), :]
3×2 DataFrame
 Row │ x      y        
     │ Int64  Float64  
─────┼─────────────────
   1 │     3  0.555818
   2 │     7  0.818728
   3 │     8  0.792478```
